definition: to make a report (to a superior)/to give/to endow/to receive/petition
poetic essay/taxation/to bestow on/to endow with

sentences.english: One cannot overlook his uncanny ability to navigate the many political intrigues and maneuverings.
sentences.chinese: 沒人能忽略他平息各種政治陰謀詭計的稟賦。

sentences.english: But this instinct is, for all intents and purposes, an evolutionary novelty among humans.
sentences.chinese: 但實際上，這是在進化過程中人類獲得的特有的稟賦。

sentences.english: All souls as they were cast from the Tao had an endowment.
sentences.chinese: 所有的靈魂在道中被鑄時，都有一個稟賦。

sentences.english: The prowess and endowment are the prowler's wager to the dowdy dowager.
sentences.chinese: 英勇和稟賦是潛行者下給衣衫襤褸的富孀的賭注。

sentences.english: She was gifted with literary brilliancy while she shouldered the responsibility of supporting her family.
sentences.chinese: 她稟賦超凡的文才，又肩負着家庭生活的重擔。

sentences.english: We don't need a special gift for language learning.
sentences.chinese: 我們不需要語言學習的特殊稟賦。

sentences.english: All the gifts of physical beauty have been lavished on it.
sentences.chinese: 它不吝惜在大地上展現一切身體美感的稟賦。

sentences.english: Such confidence stems largely from the genius of America.
sentences.chinese: 這種自信源於美國人的稟賦。

sentences.english: The third-part collateral increases the indirect financing ability of SMEs.
sentences.chinese: 第三方擔保可以幫助稟賦不足的企業融資。

definition: (abbr. for 嘗試錯誤|尝试错误) trial and error/failure
competitive/ambitious and aggressive/to desire to beat others
after hard work and numerous revisions (idiom)/the vicissitudes of life
different routes to the same destination (idiom); fig. different means of achieve the same end
